roleset.name: motion

role.descr: end point, end state of arg1

example.name: go-v: start and end points
example.text: What flights go from Seattle to Boston via Minneapolis ?

example.name: go-v: extent
example.text: Imports have gone down 33 %

example.name: go-v: extent and end point
example.text: Woolworth went up 1 3/4 to 59 1/2 .

example.name: go-v: with direction, don't be fooled by animate subject! This movement is not construed as self-directed here!
example.text: A lot of people would like to go back to 1970 .

example.name: go-v: as 'extend'
example.text: At closely held Deltec Securities Corp. , junk bond money managers Amy K. Minella and Hannah H. Strasser say the problems of the junk market go deeper than a temporary malaise .

propbank.arg: the problems of the junk market

example.name: go-v: and keep going!
example.text: The protesters who greeted Mikhail Gorbachev at East Berlin 's airport earlier this month were n't shouting `` Go U.S.A '' -- they were chanting `` Gorby , Help Us . ''

roleset.note: GO-V NOTES: Member of VNcls meander-47.7, escape-51.1-2. (from go.01-v)

Treebank uses every possible syntax for the stock-report usage of this sense. You'll have to dig into constituents to pull these args apart. The "direction" arg is more mandatory than the ArgM label would suggest. (from go.01-v)

roleset.name: self-directed motion, disapear or go away

example.name: go-v: journey
example.text: He and two colleagues went on an overnight fishing trip .

example.name: go-v: end point
example.text: The lawyers went to work

example.name: go-v: with manner
example.text: Currently in the middle of a four - week , 20 - city tour as a solo pianist , Mr. Glass has left behind his synthesizers , equipment and collaborators in favor of going it alone .

example.name: going-n: as nominal
example.text: `` I think Bush 's going there is a helpful sign , '' said Sen. Terry Sanford ( D. , N.C. ) a member of the Foreign Relations Committee who pushed to provide Costa Rica about the same amount of aid as it received last year .

example.name: gone-j: go on vacation, leave habitual places
example.text: I am gone for three weeks on vacation .

example.name: gone-j: MIA
example.text: The pen is gone .

example.name: gone-j: Gone from place
example.text: I am gone from the forum for two days and what happens ?

roleset.note: GO-V NOTES: Member of VNcls escape-51.1-2. (from go.02-v)

GONE-J NOTES: Based on Thyme and Sharp data. Comparison to and extention of go.02 and leave.01. Go.02 is a member of VN class escape-51.1-2. Leave.01 is a member of VN classes escape-51.1-1, leave-51.2-1, and resign-10.11. Framed by Katie. (from gone.01-j)
GO-V NOTES: This is an incorrect parse from Treebank; "be gone" is clearly notpassive but rather copula+adjective. I hope this is anisolated example (it's not, unfortunately) (from go.13-v)

roleset.name: pursue (often with after)

example.name: go-v: go after
example.text: Portfolio managers go after the highest rates .

roleset.note: GO-V NOTES: No VNcls. (from go.03-v)

roleset.name: modal / future

example.name: go-v: modal
example.text: I 'm going to eat lunch now .

roleset.note: GO-V NOTES: No VNcls. (from go.04-v)
Do not tag! (leave the rel, of course). (from go.04-v)

roleset.name: serial verb construction

example.name: go-v: very typical
example.text: He went looking for a replacement for Mr. Landry .

propbank.arg: looking for a replacement for Mr. Landry

roleset.note: GO-V NOTES: This is dangerously close to the modal construction, except there's no"to" (ie, "I'm going to leave now"). Includes the idiom "go begging". (from go.05-v)

roleset.name: proceed (with a variety of prepositions)

example.name: go-v: transitive and direction
example.text: Boeing goes ahead with its plans for the 767 .

example.name: go-v: intransitive, direction only
example.text: Mrs. Yeagin went into education .

example.name: go-v: ergative
example.text: Boeing 's plans for the 767 went without a hitch .

example.name: go-v: transitive, no direction
example.text: They went about it with a systematic approach .

example.name: go-n: Light verb 'give the go_ahead'
example.text: Coulson ' gave the go - ahead for Royal phone hacking ' .

roleset.note: GO-V NOTES: No VNcls. (from go.06-v)

roleset.name: sell

example.name: go-v: unaccusative with price
example.text: Chateau Yquem now goes for $ 100 a bottle

roleset.note: GO-V NOTES: No VNcls. (from go.07-v)

roleset.name: become

example.name: go-v: go private
example.text: Georgia Gulf will go private .

example.name: go-v: go off
example.text: The lights went off last night .

example.name: go-v: with another argument
example.text: Contel 's Mr. Wohlstetter said the group of Big Board companies is n't ready to go public yet with its effort , and that he does n't plan to be the leader once it is public .

propbank.arg: the group of Big Board companies

example.name: go-v: less become, more continue
example.text: What 's more , the losses they and the others caused `` are just what we are stumbling over , '' says Mr. Stapf , adding that the majority of misdeeds probably go undetected .

roleset.note: GO-V NOTES: Related to VNcls marvel-31.3 (go_apeshit, go_ballistic are members, but not just plain 'go'.) (from go.08-v)
Use this sense for inceptive uses of go, such as become at war - to start war.

roleset.name: operate

example.name: go-v: work
example.text: The order printers start to go on the trading floor .

roleset.note: GO-V NOTES: No VNcls. (from go.09-v)

roleset.name: benefactive

example.name: go-v: with receiver
example.text: The rest went to investors from France and Hong Kong .

propbank.arg: to investors from France and Hong Kong

example.name: go-v: with purpose
example.text: $ 455 million will go for antitrust enforcement .

example.name: go-v: go with
example.text: Bethlehem had little choice but to go with a European steelmaker , because its competitors already have tapped the Japanese and South Korean industry leaders , analysts noted .

roleset.note: GO-V NOTES: No VNcls. (from go.10-v)

roleset.name: serve

example.name: go-v: only in TV criminal/courtroom dramas?
example.text: The crime goes to character .

example.name: go-v: goes without saying
example.text: Which goes to show that the First Law applies in insurance as in anything else : There is no free lunch , there is only marketing .

propbank.arg: to show that the First Law applies in insurance as in anything else : There is no free lunch , there is only marketing

example.name: go-v: with GOL
example.text: That goes for Israel too , if Egypt or Syria were anything worthwhile , Israel would n't of got what they did .

roleset.note: GO-V NOTES: This seems close to the benefactive, hence its placement here. I also read the purpose clause as goes "to prove character". (from go.11-v)

roleset.name: experience, undergo

example.name: go-v: oh the agony
example.text: This market is still going through its pains

roleset.note: GO-V NOTES: Be wary of the distinction with motion through some medium, such as"John goes through the park on his way to school."(from go.12-v)

roleset.name: be left

example.name: go-v: left
example.text: With 15 seconds of trading to go , ...

roleset.note: GO-V NOTES: always infinitival? (from go.14-v)

roleset.name: have on your side

example.name: go-v: the only thing?
example.text: The one thing Mr. Phillips clearly does have going for him is continuity , although it is n't certain if that will be enough .

roleset.note: GO-V NOTES: No VNcls. (from go.21-v)

roleset.name: go with, match, accompany

role.descr: what you get for free, matching thing

example.name: go-v: and a set of Ginsu knives
example.text: Instead , they focus on events in department stores and pour their promotional budgets into gifts that go along with purchases .

roleset.note: GO-V NOTES: No VNcls. (from go.22-v)

roleset.name: say

example.name: go-v: non-agentive speaker
example.text: The old saying goes : ' Officials come and go , but yamen [ government offices in feudal China ] are made of iron . '

propbank.arg: ' Officials come and go , but yamen [ government offices in feudal China ] are made of iron . '

roleset.note: GO-V NOTES: predicate added by Arrick (from go.23-v)

roleset.name: existential

example.name: go-v: existential there
example.text: Well there you go .

roleset.note: GO-V NOTES: predicate added by Arrick (from go.24-v)

roleset.name: potty

example.name: go-v: Arg 0 only
example.text: Patient reports that , since the procedure , he is going 10 - 15 times a day .

example.name: go-v: in case you couldn't figure out arg 1
example.text: Mary told mom that the dog went number 2 on the rug .

roleset.note: GO-V NOTES: No VNcls. (from go.29-v)

roleset.name: an attempt, effort

example.name: go-n: All args, nominal
example.text: Alfie backstage getting ready for his go at Elvis .

roleset.note: GO-N NOTES: Roleset based on instances in BOLT P01, part 4. Loosely based on attempt-v.01. Be careful because "have a go" is a roleset for "have" (have.10), so it shouldn't be treated as an LV. (from go.01-n)

roleset.name: attack or insult

example.name: go-n: All args, within LVC again
example.text: I 'd like to make this clear : It 's not the Muslims we 're having a go at but the officials .

example.name: go-n: All args, with cause, again LVC
example.text: She had a go at him for being late .

roleset.note: GO-N NOTES: Roleset based on instances in BOLT P01, part 4. Loosely based on attack-v.01. (from go.02-n)

roleset.name: spatial positioning; belong in a spot

role.descr: if arg1 spans a space, first boundary (source)
if arg1 spans a space, second boundary (goal)
if arg1 is 3D, third boundary for third dimension

example.name: go-v: with orientation
example.text: The block should go on its side .
example.amr: (r / recommend-01 :ARG1 (g / go-35 :ARG1 (b / block) :ARG6 (o / on-04 :ARG1 b :ARG2 (s / side :part-of b))))

example.name: go-v: with arg3 and arg5
example.text: My battleship goes from G1 to G5 .
example.amr: (g / go-35 :ARG1 (b / battleship :poss (i / i)) :ARG3 (s / space :location (c / cartesian-coordinate-entity :x "G" :y 1)) :ARG4 (s2 / space :location (c2 / cartesian-coordinate-entity :x "G" :y 5)))

example.name: go-v: with arg2
example.text: So the red block goes there .

roleset.note: GO NOTES: fictive motion sense split off from go.01 for SpatialAMR.

roleset.name: go on: occur, continue

example.name: go_on-v: ergative
example.text: The professor 's droning voice goes on endlessly .

example.name: go_on-v: transitive
example.text: A state court judge has allowed the charity to go on soliciting funds .

roleset.note: GO_ON-V NOTES: Member of VNcls begin-55.1. (from go.15-v)
ONGOING_ON-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from ongoing.15-j)

roleset.name: continue speaking

example.name: go_on-v: He goes on for a while...
example.text: He goes on , By putting the underlying origin of the , uh , street children class in Egypt under the microscope , you will find that one of the most dangerous reasons behind their growth is the chaotic migration from the countryside to the cities , and to a certain extent , the ruralization of the cities and the urbanization of the countryside .

propbank.arg: By putting the underlying origin of the , uh , street children class in Egypt under the microscope , you will find that one of the most dangerous reasons behind their growth is the chaotic migration from the countryside to the cities , and to a certain extent , the ruralization of the cities and the urbanization of the countryside

roleset.note: GO_ON-V NOTES: Roleset based on instances in webtext-p2.5 (2500-2999). Comparison to other communication verbs. Framed by Claire (from go.25-v)

roleset.name: become on

example.name: go_off-v: bomb goes off
example.text: It 's a time bomb just waiting to go off .

roleset.note: GO_OFF-V NOTES: No VNcls. (from go.16-v)

roleset.name: leave

example.name: go_out-v: like a lamb
example.text: Airlines in 1989 came in like a bang and are going out like a whimper .

roleset.note: GO_OUT-V NOTES: Related to VNcls escape-51.1-2, but verb particle construction is not member. (from go.17-v)

roleset.name: extinguish

example.name: go_out-v: nirvana
example.text: The light went out .

example.name: go_out-v
example.text: Well unless of course the third compressor he put in the car goes out .

propbank.arg: the third compressor he put in the car

roleset.note: GO_OUT-V NOTES: (from go.18-v)

roleset.name: date

example.name: go_out-v: romance
example.text: No , he tells Yomna a couple of nice words and goes out with her to fool around and then he would n't talk to her again , he 's dirty and she allows him to degrade her

roleset.note: GO_OUT-V NOTES: Added by Julia for BOLT

roleset.name: return to being

role.descr: thing going back to previous state

example.name: go_back-v: return
example.text: The board and UAL 's management ca n't go back to business as usual .

roleset.note: GO_BACK-V NOTES: Cf. get, return. Member of VNcls convert-26.6.2. (from go.19-v)

roleset.name: come to completion

example.name: go_through-v: let's make a deal
example.text: We 're in no way committed to a deal going through at all .

example.name: go_through-v: both args
example.text: Has anyone else got stuff cheap like this and the seller went through with it or not ?

roleset.note: GO_THROUGH-V NOTES: Note the distinction between this and other "go through" usages(physical motion through a medium, undergoing some experience) (from go.20-v)

roleset.name: review, discuss, analyze, explain

example.name: go_over-v: Arg0,1, COM
example.text: The surgeon went over the procedure with the nurses before beginning .

roleset.note: GO_OVER-V NOTES: compare to review, analyze (from go.26-v)

roleset.name: be received, create an impression

example.name: go_over-v: with MNR
example.text: While I do not underestimate the stupidity of the American voter , Romney 's Gorden Gekko greed is good past is n't going *-1 to go over very well this year .

roleset.note: GO_OVER-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT. No VNcls. (from go.30-v)

roleset.name: happen

example.name: go_down-v: from BOLT
example.text: If ahmadinejad did say this , does he have any info as to what-2 [*-2]-1 is gon [*-1] na go down ?

roleset.note: GO_DOWN-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT. No VNcls. (from go.27-v)

roleset.name: experience, undergo

example.name: undergo-v: pretty typical
example.text: Periods before the advent of futures or program trading were often more volatile , usually when fundamental market conditions were undergoing change ( 1973 - 75 , 1937 - 40 , and 1928 - 33 for example ) .

example.name: under_go-v: both args
example.text: Patient under went neoadjuvant chemotherapy and radiation

roleset.note: UNDERGO-V NOTES: No Vncls. Comparison with 'go through'. (from undergo.01-v)
UNDER_GO-V NOTES: Based on tempral and stratified data. Comparison to go.12. Framed by Katie. (from go.28-v)

roleset.name: telling time: after X o'clock

example.name: gone-j
example.text: Teacher , last night it was gone seven clock when I 'd finished electron microscopy , and then I went out to have something to eat .

roleset.note: GONE-J NOTES: Added by Julia for BOLT. Don't tag the dummy "it"
